title: Witnesses Fled Bondi Beach as Gunmen Targeted Jewish Event
summary: Gunshots ripped through a Hanukkah celebration in Sydney, Australia, killing at least 12 people.

title: What We Know About the Deadly Shooting at Brown University
summary: Two people were killed and nine others injured during an attack on the Rhode Island campus. Officials were searching early Sunday for a gunman suspected in the shooting.

title: Gunshots, Sirens and a Manhunt Transform Brown’s Campus
summary: A typical Saturday night on the Ivy League campus was shaken by the killing of two people and the wounding of 9 others.

title: A Brown University Instructor Hid From Gunfire With His Students
summary: Joseph Oduro, 21, said he was leading an economics study session for about 60 students when a masked man entered the room and started shooting.

title: The S.E.C. Was Tough on Crypto. It Pulled Back After Trump Returned to Office.
summary: An investigation by The Times found the administration’s change in enforcement benefited the industry, including companies that had ties to the president.

title: How The Times Analyzed the S.E.C.’s Cryptocurrency Enforcement
summary: The New York Times set out to understand — and quantify — just how much things had changed within the agency after President Trump resumed office.

title: Deadly Attack in Syria on U.S. Troops Exposes Growing Challenges for Country’s Leader
summary: The attacks further complicate President Ahmed al-Sharaa’s efforts to unify the country and rebuild relationships with the international community, analysts say.

title: What We Know About the American Troops in Syria
summary: The killing of three Americans during what was said to be a counterterrorism operation in central Syria served as a reminder that U.S. troops are still operating in the country.

title: The War on ‘Wokeness’ Comes to the U.S. Mint
summary: The Treasury Department unveiled new coins celebrating America’s 250th anniversary. They failed to include planned designs featuring abolition, women’s suffrage and the civil rights movement.

title: The Army Made a Blind Black Soldier a Surrogate for Robert E. Lee
summary: For more than a century, this Black soldier from Virginia was remembered by nearly no one. Then this year, someone at the Pentagon found a use for him.

title: The Dark Side of the Global Surrogacy and Fertility Industry
summary: Eve was one of dozens of Thai women who traveled 4,000 miles to become surrogates, on the promise of generous fees. It turned into a nightmare.

title: The Billionaires Have Gone Full Louis XV
summary: The first rule of dark money is to quit blabbing about it. Did they think people would thank them for it?

title: Floods, Mud and Cold Add to Gazans’ Misery
summary: The rainstorm that battered the enclave this week has left many shivering in tent camps. Despite a cease-fire, rebuilding is still a long way off.

title: AfD Pushes to Publish German Information That Officials Say May Help Russia
summary: Opponents of AfD lawmakers say that their push to publish sensitive details about national security could benefit Russian military planning.

title: Washington Residents Return Home to Extensive Flood Damage
summary: After heavy rains swelled rivers and flooded neighborhoods in northern Washington, residents returned to soggy homes caked in mud. Many tried to salvage what they could.

title: Chile Votes in Presidential Runoff
summary: Jeannette Jara and José Antonio Kast are facing off on Sunday in a deeply polarized election marked by concerns over security and immigration.
